column8: text

Kulai MP Teo Nie Ching says Muhyiddin cannot speak on behalf of Pakatan Harapan on this matter as UEC has always been on the opposition coalition's manifesto.DAP’s Teo Nie Ching today pointed out that Pakatan Harapan’s manifesto clearly states the opposition coalition will recognise the Unified Examination Certificate (UEC), when dismissing Muhyiddin Yassin’s claim that PH would not do so.“Perhaps Tan Sri Muhyiddin can take a look,” she wrote on her Facebook wall.When contacted, the Kulai MP also said the former education minister could not speak on behalf of PH on this matter as “recognising UEC has always been our common agenda”.“It is in Buku Jingga and the People’s Manifesto, which were produced in 2013,” she told FMT when contacted.This came in response to an earlier report by Sin Chew Daily, quoting Muhyiddin as saying that PH may not recognise the UEC qualification if it seizes federal power in the upcoming polls.The Kulai MP also expressed shock when she first saw Muhyiddin’s remarks, labelling them as awkward.“First of all, I don’t think DAP was consulted over this issue. We welcome all forces to join our fight against Umno and (Prime Minister) Najib Razak.“But for Muhyiddin to say that Pakatan may not recognise UEC … I don’t think he is in a position to say that.”The UEC is a standardised examination conducted by the United Chinese School Committees’ Association of Malaysia (Dong Zhong) in 60 Chinese independent secondary schools in the country.Muhyiddin, who’s also Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) president, said earlier today that in order to recognise the UEC, it must first include the History subject, because its current syllabus and exams do not reflect national values.Responding to that remark, MCA Youth secretary-general Leong Kim Soon said Muhyiddin cannot challenge the loyalty and patriotism of UEC students.“UEC students study Bahasa Malaysia, sing the Negaraku during the school assembly and also sit for the SPM exam.“Now that Muhyiddin has openly declared and warned that PH may not recognise the UEC, it is time for DAP to come clean and admit the opposition rejects the UEC.”http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...ects-muhyiddin/ Muhyiddin: Pakatan Harapan May Not Recognise, Unified Examination Certificate (UEC)https://forum.lowyat.net/index.php?showtopic=4171254&hl=UEC

Now since PR is dead already, any mutual official statement from the current PH stating that they will rely on Buku Jingga?Because apparently PEMUDA PAN@AMANAH stated that a new manifesto for PH must include the youths' views as well. So technically it can be assumed that Buku Jingga is no longer the official manifesto of PH. hmm.. based on the link, Muhyiddin never said anything on behalf of PH...more like conditional assumption ...of course if PH policy is to allow independent schools to do as they wish, then UEC will be fully recognized as it is.At that rate,  I would Assume no reasonable malay would vote for PH anymore....
PH gaduh mesti melalui media...

I don't know what is your beef.  She was qualifying that “recognising UEC has always been our common agenda” with references to Buku Jingga and the People's Manifesto.  So, the old coalition has broken up.  Does it mean the manifesto or whatever you call it, the very one they used in their election campaign, tak boleh pakai anymore?We should hold them, each of the parties, to it.  They broke up, that's their problem.  You might argue Amanah is new but their current members in Parliament also shared the same common agenda when they ran under PAS.
Takde gaduh.  Just responding to what Muhyiddin allegedly said.
No lah.  Just setting the record straight.  Muhyiddin also not qualified to speak for PH.  Heck, his party isn't even in PH.
But both PH an PPBM have agreed to form a new coalition. Surely he's able to speak on behalf of that coalition to a certain degree.I actually agree on Muhyiddin's and BN's stance this time.
Is it?  Seems they only have an electoral pact.  No coalition yet.
They haven't formed it yet but they did sign an agreement last month to form one so it's only a matter of time.
I might have missed it but all I remember is that there was only an electoral pact.   Nothing more.  There was talk of Bersatu joining PH but it only remained as talk.

What Beef, I'm just pointing out what Tion Ni Ching is just mirroring what she alleged Moo-hyidin is doing which is self-representing PH~ when neither of them is speaking on behalf of Pakatan Harapan. Unless a new manifesto has been officially issued, to simply slate that Buku Jingga is Pakatan Harapan's manifesto is inaccurate or else Pemuda PAN wouldn't be suggesting the involvement of PAN's youth in the future manifesto. So Tiong's latest statement that Pakatan WILL acknowledge UEC is an official policy of which Pakatan? PAKATAN RAKYAT or PAKATAN HARAPAN?

Tu future manifesto.  Now no manifesto ah?  Damn, I want to hold them to whatever manifesto that they used to get themselves elected.   Actually, we should and we must.  PSTeoh is not mirroring lah.  IMO.

DAP's position on the common policy framework after the demise of Pakatan Rakyat.  https://limkitsiang.com/archive/2015/july15/lks7973.phpApology that Pakatan Rakyat is dead but vow that PR Common Policy Framework aspirations for an united, inclusive, progressive, just and prosperous Malaysia will live on and continue to be basis of DAP struggle for a new Malaysia until there is a new government in Putrajaya

Well, it's your opinion afterall. And I'm still with mine:1: Tiong Ni Ching cakap tak serupa bikin, sama macam Moo-hyidin;2. Buku Jingga is Pakatan Rakyat's Manifesto;3. PR is already pronounced dead;4. PH is not PR;5. Buku Jingga is not PH's manifesto.Well that's what I thought la~ oh if so much so that Buku Jingga should be continued by PH, when will PH state-gomen-funded Institute of Higher Learning such as UNISEL be giving free education to their students as to be aligned with the policies of Buku Jingga? It's already 2017.

Her actual post - https://www.facebook.com/TeoNieChing/photos...1766504/?type=3She said Pakatan only.  I don't know which Pakatan is she referring to.By all means, hold them to the manifesto that they used to get into power.  So, you go needle them about UNISEL.
I did~ against Nik Nazmi at his FB page, damn he even got the guts to stray from the issue. Serupa BN pun ada~

Now I am wondering what is all this silly argument about.  I don't see her referring to the Common Framework Policy or Buku Jingga as PH's policy.  The Facebook post, was a reference to Pakatan.  The photo posted was Pakatan Rakyat (it is mentioned there)'s common framework policy.  Waste time only lah.

Oh, so easy serupa dengan BN ah.   I don't know about you, but I do try to be more discerning.PSBut wait.  Aren't you needling him with the premise that PH would continue to adhere to the policy/manifesto?  So, why not the same with Teo for this case?
next : buku biru or kuning?

Don't worry, I still believe PH is waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay better than BN, but better to curb the damaging mentality of BN which sometimes can be seen within PH itself or else it will become a serious disease in the future. Do not want Neo-BN 3.0 to exist.
Eh?  Why hold PH to such high standards?   Your expectations are very high.  You are only going to end up disappointed.   PSI added a PS to my post above.

End up being disappointed? I'm already feeling a little bit disappointed.And by the way, even without referring to the PR's Buku Jingga in my criticism against Nik Nazmi, the scrutiny against Nik Nazmi is still a legit one as he is the Exco Pendidikan and he's the one who promoted Free Education as can be seen in this news article a few days ago~http://www.sinarharian.com.my/kolumnis/nik...-ptptn-1.607379
LOL  Whatever it is, I know I would be more disappointed if BN wins again.  Anyway, go needle him some more.
